content.text:
# 17th Directors Guild of America Awards

| location      =
| country       = United States
| presenter     = Directors Guild of America
| award1_type   = Best Director Feature Film:
| award1_winner = My Fair Lady – George Cukor
| award2_type   = Best Director Television:
| award2_winner = Profiles in Courage for "Oscar W. Underwood" – Lamont Johnson
| previous      = 16th
| main          = DGA Awards
| next          = 18th
}}
The 17th Directors Guild of America Awards, honoring the outstanding directorial achievements in film and television in 1964, were presented in 1965.
Winners and nominees
Film
{| class=wikitable style="width="100%"
|-
! colspan="2" style="background:#abcdef;"| Feature Film
|-
| colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;"|
'George Cukor – My Fair Lady'
* Peter Glenville – Becket
* John Huston – The Night of the Iguana
* Stanley Kubrick – Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
* Robert Stevenson – Mary Poppins
|}
Television
{| class=wikitable style="width="100%"
|-
! colspan="2" style="background:#abcdef;"| Television
|-
| colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;"|
'Lamont Johnson – Profiles in Courage for "Oscar W. Underwood"'
* Paul Bogart – The Defenders for "The Seven Hundred Year Old Gang"
* Jerry Paris – The Dick Van Dyke Show for "The Life and Love of Joe Coogan"
* Stuart Rosenberg – The Defenders for "Blacklist"
* George Schaefer – Hallmark Hall of Fame for "Abe Lincoln in Illinois"
|}
Honorary Life Member
* Jack L. Warner
